featured.text: The additional tines made diners less likely to drop food, and the curved tines served as a scoop so people did not have to constantly switch to a spoon while eating.
The tines prevented meat from twisting or moving during carving and allowed food to slide off more easily than it would with a knife.
Forks at that time were fairly large with two tines that aided in the carving of meat in the kitchen.
In late 17th century France, larger forks with four curved tines were developed.

definition.zh_def: 尖頭，特別是指動物的牙齒或器官的尖端部分。
definition.en_def: A sharp point or prong, especially on a tooth or a similar structure.
definition.example: The fork has three tines that make it easy to pick up food.
